meanings.definition: The study of mathematical concepts and techniques that are necessary for the study of calculus.
meanings.sent1: In precalculuses, students learn about basic math concepts before moving on to calculus.
meanings.sent2: I have to take precalculuses before I can enroll in calculus next semester.
meanings.sent3: The precalculuses class was like a warm-up before the intense calculus workout.
meanings.sent4: Understanding precalculuses is like laying a strong foundation for a tall building of calculus knowledge.
meanings.sent5: Her passion for precalculuses made even the most complex concepts seem simple and exciting.

meanings.definition: A course or set of courses that cover the material needed for calculus.
meanings.sent1: The precalculuses at our school is designed to prepare students for the challenges of calculus.
meanings.sent2: I signed up for precalculuses to make sure I am ready for calculus next year.
meanings.sent3: Taking precalculuses felt like getting a sneak peek into the world of calculus.
meanings.sent4: The precalculuses course acted as a bridge between basic math and the advanced concepts of calculus.
meanings.sent5: The precalculuses textbook was filled with helpful explanations and practice problems.
